      • getState

        public HttpConfigurable getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface PersistentStateComponent<HttpConfigurable>
        Returns:
        a component state. All properties, public and annotated fields are serialized. Only values, which differ from the default (i.e., the value of newly instantiated class) are serialized. null value indicates that the returned state won't be stored, as a result previously stored state will be used.
        See Also:
        XmlSerializer

      • loadState

        public void loadState(HttpConfigurable state)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentStateComponent
        This method is called when new component state is loaded. The method can and will be called several times, if config files were externally changed while IDE was running.

        State object should be used directly, defensive copying is not required.

        Specified by:
        loadState in interface PersistentStateComponent<HttpConfigurable>
        Parameters:
        state - loaded component state
        See Also:
        XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(Object, Object)

        public void prepareURL(java.lang.String url)
                throws java.io.IOException
        todo [all] It is NOT necessary to call anything if you obey common IDE proxy settings; todo if you want to define your own behaviour, refer to CommonProxy Also, this method is useful in a way that it tests connection to the host [through proxy].

      • openHttpConnection

        public java.net.HttpURLConnection openHttpConnection(java.lang.String location)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Opens HTTP connection to a given location using configured http proxy settings.
        Parameters:
        location - url to connect to
        Returns:
        instance of HttpURLConnection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of any I/O troubles or if created connection isn't instance of HttpURLConnection.
